I20060912-0800

Hyperlink listener notification throws an AIOOBE when a listener is removed in a callback. 

To reproduce, use the code below as body of SampleAction.run(IAction) in a "Hello, World" plugin. The problem is that the 3 AbstractHyperlink.handle*(Event) methods try to iterate over the live listener list.

The fix is either to use core.runtime.ListenerList, or to copy the 'listeners' vector and then iterate over the copied list.

----------------------------------
	final Shell shell= new Shell(window.getShell(), SWT.TITLE | SWT.APPLICATION_MODAL);
	shell.setLayout(new GridLayout());
	
	Hyperlink hyperlink= new Hyperlink(shell, SWT.NONE);
	hyperlink.setText("Close");
	hyperlink.addHyperlinkListener(new HyperlinkAdapter() {
		public void linkActivated(HyperlinkEvent e) {
			shell.dispose();
		}
	});
	
	HyperlinkGroup hyperlinkGroup= new HyperlinkGroup(shell.getDisplay());
	hyperlinkGroup.add(hyperlink);
	
	shell.pack();
	shell.open();
----------------------------------
